notes.text:
A security update is now available for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4 from the Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

This release of Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.1 serves as a replacement for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.0, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes document linked to in the References.

Security Fix(es):

* keycloak: verify-token-audience support is missing in the NodeJS adapter (CVE-2020-1694)

* keycloak: Lack of checks in ObjectInputStream leading to Remote Code Execution (CVE-2020-1714)

* js-jquery: jquery: Cross-site scripting due to improper injQuery.htmlPrefilter method (CVE-2020-11022)

* js-jquery: jQuery: passing HTML containing <option> elements to manipulation methods could result in untrusted code execution (CVE-2020-11023)

* undertow: invalid HTTP request with large chunk size (CVE-2020-10719)

* keycloak: top-level navigations to data URLs resulting in XSS are possible (incomplete fix of CVE-2020-1697) (CVE-2020-10748)

* jackson-databind: Lacks certain xbean-reflect/JNDI blocking (CVE-2020-8840)

* jackson-databind: Serialization gadgets in shaded-hikari-config (CVE-2020-9546)

* jackson-databind: Serialization gadgets in ibatis-sqlmap (CVE-2020-9547)

* jackson-databind: Serialization gadgets in anteros-core (CVE-2020-9548)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.1 security update

cwe.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak, where the NodeJS adapter did not support the verify-token-audience. This flaw results in  some users having access to sensitive information outside of their permissions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: verify-token-audience support is missing in the NodeJS adapter
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: keycloak: verify-token-audience support is missing in the NodeJS adapter

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak, where the code base contains usages of ObjectInputStream without type checks. This flaw allows an attacker to inject arbitrarily serialized Java Objects, which would then get deserialized in a privileged context and potentially lead to remote code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: Lack of checks in ObjectInputStream leading to Remote Code Execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
There is currently no known mitigation for this issue.

vulnerabilities.title: keycloak: Lack of checks in ObjectInputStream leading to Remote Code Execution

notes.text: A flaw was found in FasterXML jackson-databind in versions 2.0.0 through 2.9.10.2. A "gadget" exploit is possible due to a lack of a Java object being blocking from being deserialized. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: Lacks certain xbean-reflect/JNDI blocking
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenStack Platform ships OpenDaylight, which contains the vulnerable jackson-databind. However, OpenDaylight does not expose jackson-databind in a way that would make it vulnerable, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for OpenDaylight. As such, Red Hat will not be providing a fix for OpenDaylight at this time.

While OpenShift Container Platform's elasticsearch plugins do ship the vulnerable component, it doesn't do any of the unsafe things described in https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3279231. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

Red Hat Satellite 6 does not enable polymorphic deserialization which is a required configuration for the vulnerability to be used. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

notes.text: A flaw was found in jackson-databind 2.x in versions prior to 2.9.10.4. FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x mishandles the interaction between serialization gadgets and typing. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Undertow, regarding the processing of invalid HTTP requests with large chunk sizes. This flaw allows an attacker to take advantage of HTTP request smuggling.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: undertow: invalid HTTP request with large chunk size

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak's data filter, where it allowed the processing of data URLs in some circumstances. This flaw allows an attacker to conduct cross-site scripting or further attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: top-level navigations to data URLs resulting in XSS are possible (incomplete fix of CVE-2020-1697)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: keycloak: top-level navigations to data URLs resulting in XSS are possible (incomplete fix of CVE-2020-1697)

notes.text: A flaw was found in jackson-databind 2.x in versions prior to 2.9.10.4. The interaction between serialization gadgets and typing is mishandled. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: Serialization gadgets in javax.swing.JEditorPane
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
While OpenShift Container Platform's elasticsearch plugins do ship the vulnerable component, it doesn't do any of the unsafe things described in https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3279231. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

Red Hat OpenStack Platform ships OpenDaylight, which contains the vulnerable jackson-databind. However, OpenDaylight does not expose jackson-databind in a way that would make it vulnerable, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for OpenDaylight. As such, Red Hat will not be providing a fix for OpenDaylight at this time.

Red Hat Satellite 6 does not enable polymorphic deserialization which is a required configuration for the vulnerability to be used. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

The PKI module as shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 does not enable polymorphic deserialization which is a required configuration for the vulnerability to be used, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for the Product. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

The following conditions are needed for an exploit, we recommend avoiding all if possible
* Deserialization from sources you do not control
* `enableDefaultTyping()`
* `@JsonTypeInfo using `id.CLASS` or `id.MINIMAL_CLASS`

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in JQuery. This flaw allows an attacker with the ability to supply input to the âHTMLâ function to inject Javascript into the page where that input is rendered, and have it delivered by the browser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Cross-site scripting due to improper injQuery.htmlPrefilter method
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: No supported release of Red Hat OpenStack Platform is affected by this vulnerability as no shipped packages contain the vulnerable code.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in jQuery. HTML containing \<option\> elements from untrusted sources are passed, even after sanitizing, to one of jQuery's DOM manipulation methods, which may execute untrusted code. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Untrusted code execution via <option> tag in HTML passed to DOM manipulation methods
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux versions 6, 7, and 8 ship a vulnerable version of JQuery in the `pcs` component. However, the vulnerability has not been found to be exploitable in reasonable scenarios. 

In RHEL7, pcs-0.9.169-3.el7_9.3 [RHSA-2022:7343] contains an updated version of jquery (3.6.0), which does not contain the vulnerable code.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
